mechanism_of_action.References: Gilman, A. G., L. S. Goodman, and A. Gilman. (eds.). Goodman and Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics. 6th ed. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co., Inc. 1980., p. 1260
mechanism_of_action.Value: THE MOST IMPORTANT PHARMACOLOGICAL ACTIONS OF THE ALKYLATING AGENTS ARE THOSE THAT DISTURB THE FUNDAMENTAL MECHANISMS CONCERNED WITH CELL GROWTH, MITOTIC ACTIVITY, DIFFERENTIATION, & FUNCTION. THE CAPACITY OF THESE DRUGS TO INTERFERE WITH NORMAL MITOSIS & CELL DIVISION IN ALL RAPIDLY PROLIFERATING TISSUES PROVIDES THE BASIS FOR THEIR THERAPEUTIC APPLICATIONS & FOR MANY OF THEIR TOXIC PROPERTIES. /ALKYLATING AGENTS/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V9 80
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: SHERMAN RATS WERE TREATED IP WITH 5-10 MG/KG BODY WT ON 11TH DAY OF PREGNANCY: HIGHER DOSES...TOXIC TO MOTHERS & CAUSED SOME FETAL RESORPTIONS & DECR FETAL & PLACENTAL WT. AT DOSES TOLERATED BY MOTHERS MANY RESORPTIONS...OBSERVED; BUT...NO MALFORMATIONS WERE SEEN. FRESHLY-PREPARED SUSPENSIONS OF 5 MG/KG TEPA IN SESAME OIL GIVEN IM TO WISTAR RATS ON THE 4TH & 5TH, 7TH & 8TH OR 11TH & 12TH DAY OF GESTATION CAUSED RESORPTION OF ALMOST ALL FETUSES.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V9 80
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: TEPA INDUCES BACK-MUTATIONS OF AUXOTROPHIC STRAIN OF SCHIZOSACCHAROMYCES POMBE, DOMINANT LETHALS IN MUSCA DOMESTICA & DOMINANT LETHALS, SEX-LINKED RECESSIVE LETHALS & Y-II-III CHROMOSOME TRANSLOCATIONS IN DROSOPHILA MELANOGASTER.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V9 80
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: FREQUENCIES OF DOMINANT LETHALS WERE SIGNIFICANTLY INCR IN PROGENY OF MALE SWISS MICE GIVEN IP INJECTIONS OF TEPA @ DOSES RANGING FROM 0.156-20 MG/KG BODY WT. ...SIMILAR RESULTS IN A/L & C57BL/6J MICE /HAVE BEEN OBTAINED/. CD RATS GIVEN IP INJECTION OF 10 MG/KG BODY WT TEPA HAD CHROMATID ABERRATIONS IN 87.5% OF BONE-MARROW CELLS. INDUCTION OF TRANSMISSIBLE TRANSLOCATIONS HAS BEEN FOUND AFTER SINGLE IP INJECTIONS OF TEPA IN MALE SWISS ALBINO & A/L MICE.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: U. S. Department of the Interior, Fish & Wildlife Service, Bureau of Sport Fisheries & Wildlife. Handbook of Toxicity of Pesticides to Wildlife. Washington, D. C.: U. S. Government Printing Office, 1970., p. 111
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ACUTE /ORAL/ SYMPTOMS /IN WILD BIRD SPECIES/: ATAXIA, WING DROP, TACHYPNEA, DYSPNEA, NUTATIONS, TREMORS...PROSTRATION, REPEATED WING-BEAT CONVULSIONS. MORTALITIES OCCURRED 4 HR TO 10 DAYS AFTER TREATMENT.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: U. S. Department of the Interior, Fish & Wildlife Service, Bureau of Sport Fisheries & Wildlife. Handbook of Toxicity of Pesticides to Wildlife. Washington, D. C.: U. S. Government Printing Office, 1970., p. 111
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: THE 30-DAY EMLD /EMPIRICAL MINIMUM LETHAL DOSAGE: LOWEST DAILY ORAL DOSAGE THAT PRODUCED 1 OR 2 DEATHS BY END OF THE 30-DAY PERIOD/ FOR CHUKARS IS MORE THAN 1.0 MG/KG/DAY, BUT SURVIVORS OF THIS LEVEL LATER PRODUCED MARKEDLY LESS FERTILE EGGS THAN A CONTROL GROUP RECEIVING EMPTY GELATIN CAPSULES FOR 30-DAY DOSAGE PERIOD.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V9 78
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: 6 GROUPS OF WEANLING MALE & FEMALE FISCHER RATS...GIVEN DAILY DOSES OF 0.001-0.3 MG TEPA IN STEROID SUSPENDING VEHICLE...BY GAVAGE ON 5 DAYS/WK FOR 1 YR. AVG SURVIVAL TIMES WERE 240 & 500 DAYS FOR 2 HIGHEST DOSE GROUPS & 560 DAYS FOR OTHER TREATED GROUPS. OF 58 TREATED ANIMALS, 34 DEVELOPED TUMORS: 1 ADENOCARCINOMA, 1 FIBROSARCOMA & 6 FIBROADENOMAS OF MAMMARY GLAND, 10 INTERSTITIAL CELL TUMORS & 1 MESOTHELIOMA OF TESTIS, 1 FIBROMA & 1 FIBROSARCOMA, 1 LUNG ADENOMA, 1 HEPATOMA, 2 BRONCHIAL ADENOMAS, 2 SQUAMOUS-CELL CARCINOMAS OF EAR, 1 SKIN PAPILLOMA, 3 LYMPHOMAS, 2 OTHERS & 1 BASAL-CELL CARCINOMA OF LIP, WHICH WAS ONLY TUMOR OBSERVED @ AREA OF APPLICATION. IN 653 CONTROLS, ONLY 56 TUMORS...OBSERVED @ SITES OTHER THAN THE TESTIS; INCIDENCE OF INTERSTITIAL-CELL TUMORS OF TESTIS WAS 25/26 IN MALES EXAM @ 600 DAYS; MAMMARY FIBROADENOMAS WERE INFREQUENT, BEING FOUND MOSTLY IN OLD FEMALES...

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: HARTLEY-ASP B; COMPARATIVE CLASTOGENICITY OF ANALOGUES OF THE INSECTICIDE TEPA IN VICIA FABA ROOT-TIP CELLS; MUTAT RES 85 (4): 300 (1981)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: A NUMBER OF TEPA ANALOGUES OF ESTABLISHED CHEMOSTERILITY CONTAINING DIFFERENT NUMBERS OF AZIRIDINE RINGS & WITH SIDE CHAINS OF VARIOUS LENGTHS ARE AVAILABLE. EIGHT ANALOGUES, INCLUDING TEPA & HEMPA, WERE TESTED FOR THEIR ABILITY TO PRODUCE CHROMOSOMAL ABERRATIONS IN VICIA FABA ROOT-TIP CELLS. TEPA & 6 ANALOGUES AT 7.5X10-4 & 10-3 MOLES PRODUCED A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN THE CHROMOSOMAL ABERRATION YIELD.
